subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.
author: Frank Sumption

 Hi Laura;  It was not intentional to give them only to men. Rosemary Guil=
ey has a box.  Only a few have been given boxes--it's the squeakyest wheel =
situation. 
 
 If you use the linear sweep, the circuit is very simple. Jus=
t op amps. It seems you have to use the J-FET input amps, like TL074. I tri=
ed using an LM324, but it was just too noisy. Using and older digital car t=
uner module can simlify consturction, requiring only a simple amplifier to =
drive a speaker. I use the LM386 chips f audio amps. in the sweep section I=
 use the quad op amp. Three of the channels are used for the sweept generat=
or, and the fourth is the mic amp.  I think the random mode is a pain in th=
e butt to make work, and at least to me, has no advantage.   This is the ma=
in schematic, the rest is mostly audio amplifiers, and just depends on what=
 you have, and what you can get. You could even feed the tuner audio direct=
ly to a boom box, or other external amplifier/recorder. Contrary to what so=
me say, none of this stuff is written in stone.  I have a "Mini Box" that u=
ses an older digital Walkman board, the linear sweep circuit, and a couple =
audio amps to drive the output speakers. It's just a matter of getting the =
concept, and making something that fits it. 
 
  I am increasingly reluctan=
t to provide this stuff for people that think it's their god assigned missi=
on or some damn thing. There is no one, without exception that will use the=
 box as simply a means to hear from friends, spirits, and varous entities--=
personal communications! Always it has to be treated like some stupid oracl=
e granting saintliness to the user. For me is only a source of guidence, no=
t much more than an electronic Tarot deck, or quija board. I've reached a p=
oint where I can't spend every minute working on this stuff. 
 
 Frank-S


=
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: gjk1rrfan@...: Sat, 2 Feb 2=
008 21:55:31 -0600Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.






Welcome back=
 Frank,
I have a question for you. You have given boxes all men here in the=
 group except one man has any woman been given the opportunity to have a bo=
x? I have requested one for a  long time now and even offered to pay you.
B=
ut if you just send me the schematics I will build it, I am studying electr=
onics now and here in Mexico the random would be a good thing I believe. Be=
cause even though  there=92s no English speaking stations near me all I get=
 is English J
 
Laura
 


From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank SumptionSent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 =
9:17 PMTo: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comSubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.
 
=



 There is a lack of the background hiss, and white noise of the random t=
uned systems.  The sweep circuit is simple, and using pre-made tuners a rea=
l time saver, provided a source for the older tuners can be found. I used t=
o get them from junk yards, but the old radios are getting harder to find. =
They have the advantage of all the RF components matching the chip.  Frank-=
S

 Hi Laura;<BR> <BR> It was not intentional to gi=
ve them only to men. Rosemary Guiley has a box.  Only a few have =
been given boxes--it's the squeakyest wheel situation. <BR>
 <BR>
<BR>=
 If you use the linear sweep, the circuit is very simple. Just op amps=
. It seems you have to use the J-FET input amps, like TL074. I tried using =
an LM324, but it was just too noisy. Using and older digital car tuner modu=
le can simlify consturction, requiring only a simple amplifier to drive a s=
peaker. I use the LM386 chips f audio amps. in the sweep section I use the =
quad op amp. Three of the channels are used for the sweept generator, and t=
he fourth is the mic amp.<BR> <BR> I think the random mode is a p=
ain in the butt to make work, and at least to me, has no advantage. <BR>&nb=
sp;<BR> This is the main schematic, the rest is mostly audio amplifier=
s, and just depends on what you have, and what you can get. You could even =
feed the tuner audio directly to a boom box, or other external amplifi=
er/recorder. Contrary to what some say, none of this stuff is written in st=
one.  I have a "Mini Box" that uses an older digital Walkman board,&nb=
sp;the linear sweep circuit, and a couple audio amps to driv=
e the output speakers. It's just a matter of getting the concept, and =
making something that fits it. <BR>
 <BR>
  I am increasingl=
y reluctant to provide this stuff for people that think it's their god assi=
gned mission or some damn thing. There is no one, without exception that wi=
ll use the box as simply a means to hear from friends, spirits, and varous =
entities--personal communications! Always it has to be treated like some st=
upid oracle granting saintliness to the user. For me is only a source of gu=
idence, not much more than an electronic Tarot deck, or quija board. I've r=
eached a point where I can't spend every minute working on this stuff. <BR>=

 <BR>
<BR> Frank-S<BR><BR><BR><BR><BR>
